name: Anja Wobken
background: Anja Wobken serves as Executive Producer, Documentaries at Sky Deutschland. Focus areas: Documentaries, specialist factual. They are looking for: Sports docs (Bundesliga, German athletes); true crime with unique access; contemporary history with new revelations. Overall network strategy: Sky Deutschland seeks premium, high-end documentary and specialist factual content with distinctive German perspective and production values that can compete with global streaming platforms.
thematic_priorities: premium documentaries with distinctive German perspective and high production values
Sports documentaries focusing on Bundesliga and German athletes
True crime series with unique access or perspective
Feature-length documentaries (90+ minutes) for Sky Documentaries
Multi-part documentary series (3–6 episodes) with strong narrative arc
Natural history with cinematic visual approach and cutting-edge technology
Science programming that feels contemporary and visually spectacular
History documentaries focusing on untold German stories
Preferred format: Landmark series (4–6 episodes) with distinctive approach
format_specifications: Both, depending on story and slot
budget_parameters: Documentary: €200K–€500K+ per hour; Specialist Factual: €250K–€500K+ per hour
technical_requirements: Broadcast/streaming standards; details provided upon commissioning
Subtitles/captions; audio description per broadcaster requirements
German and/or English; multilingual where applicable
submission_process: Detailed treatment with premise, format and USP
Key talent and production team credentials
Submit via Sky Deutschland portal: www.sky.de/beauftragt
additional_info: Increasing focus on distinctive voices and cross-platform reach; emphasis on diverse voices on- and off-screen; encouragement of sustainable production practices; support for projects from across German regions (where applicable); open to pitches from independent producers/companies.
